title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

Each criterion is achieved independently.
descriptions:
Response accomplishes none of the tasks set by the question.

Task A: Identify ONE way that Image 1 illustrates an effect of Mongol rule in Eurasia.

Some examples that would earn credit include:

· The image shows that the Mongol Empire promoted scientific learning.

· The image shows that the Mongols facilitated cultural contact and exchange.

· The image shows that rulers of Mongol dynasties encouraged the development of learning and technology.

Task B: Explain ONE likely purpose for the inclusion of Image 1 in the manuscript.

Some examples that would earn credit include:

· The image was likely included in the manuscript in order to demonstrate the cultural sophistication of the Mongols.

· The image was probably included in the manuscript to glorify Mongol rule.

· The most likely reason that the image was included in the manuscript was to boost the legitimacy of the Ilkhanid Mongol court in the eyes of the Persian Muslim elites.

Task C: Explain ONE way that Image 2 illustrates the spread of scientific knowledge in the period before 1450.

Some examples that would earn credit include:

Note: Responses do not need to address all parts of the Jewish-Muslim-Christian cultural contact or exchange to earn the third point.

· The image illustrates that scientific knowledge in the period before 1450 was encouraged by cross-cultural exchanges

· The fact that the Canon of Medicine was produced by a Muslim scholar and translated by Jewish scholars in Sicily shows that scientific knowledge from the Islamic world spread to other religious communities in the Mediterranean world.

· The image shows that transfers of scientific knowledge in this period took place at the courts of rulers and, it can be assumed, with the patronage and support of rulers.
Response accomplishes any one of the tasks set by the question.
Response accomplishes any two of the tasks set by the question.
Response accomplishes all three of the tasks set by the question.
